snippet: Tactical funds, with more substantial adjustments than normal E.T.F.s, are growing in popularity, but they have their skeptics.
abstract: Low cost, simplicity and ease of trading have attracted investors to exchange-traded funds, which held $86 billion in assets in September 2013; tactical funds, with more substantial adjustments than normal ETFs, are growing in popularity, but they have their skeptics.
lead_paragraph: Tactical funds, with more substantial adjustments than normal E.T.F.s, are growing in popularity, but they have their skeptics.

headline.main: Tinkering Too Much With an E.T.F. Might Not Pay
headline.print_headline: Tinkering Too Much With an E.T.F. Might Not Pay
